page.title: 08HOUSES OF SPIXWORTH
page.content: When we did a random survey in Spixworth we went to Church Lane and Buxton Road.The ages of the houses varied from about six to one thousand years.Some of the houses had one,two, three or even four storeys . One house with four floors was the oldest,some parts were about one thousand years old. We found that most of the new houses were{bungalows. All of the houses ,except the one which was a thousand years old, were made of{brick};the oldest was made of {clay lump}and{flint}.This house was very large and had about sixty windows and twenty rooms. Most houses had a living room, kitchen, and two or three bedrooms; they also had open fires as well as {central heating}.The very new houses do not have open fires.
